intro: Ruellia densa, commonly known as the dense ruellia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Ruellia densa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight.
